results.title: The Witches (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Nicolas Roeg, Mark Shivas, Jim Henson Productions and Lorimar Film Entertainment
results.brief_description: When nine year old Luke and his grandmother go for a quiet seaside holiday, they stumble upon a witches’ convention, hosted by the Grand High Witch, (Angelica Huston). When Luke becomes a victim of the witches’ scheme to rid Britain of all its children, by transforming them into mice, he devises a plot with his grandmother to finally rid the world of witches. Based on the book by Roald Dahl.

results.title: Cocktail (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Roger Donaldson, Robert W. Court, Ted Field, Interscope, Silver Screen Pictures and Touchstone
results.brief_description: When a young, confident and ambitious bartender moves to Jamaica he meets an artist and their romance brings a new perspective to his self-centered life. Stars Tom Cruise and Bryan Brown.

results.title: Number 17 = Number seventeen
results.creator_credit: Alfred Hitchcock and British International Pictures
results.brief_description: This seldom seen and often maligned film is a pivotal one in Hitchcock’s career becoming a template for the thrillers to follow. More humourous in tone from Hitchcock’s later more obsessive films, it is replete with his trademark wry touches and unusual characters. Once again an unsuspecting innocent, this time a hobo, accidentally comes across something that places him in jeopardy and faces an encounter with a gang of jewel thieves. Cast includes Leon M. Lion, Anne Grey, John Stuart and Donald Calthorpe.

results.title: Secret agent
results.creator_credit: Alfred Hitchcock, Sir Michael Balcon and Gaumont
results.brief_description: The scenario is an ambiguous one of double identity and meaning. Brodie (Geilgud) is a British novelist turned spy who travels to Switzerland under an assumed name. With him is his fictional wife, (Madeline Carroll), and an eccentric hired assassin known as “The General”, (Peter Lorre). Their mission is to find and kill a German spy, but first they must guess who he is. Based on the novel “Ashenden” by Somerset Maugham, “Secret Agent”, has many features of the quintessential Hitchcock.

results.title: Blackmail
results.creator_credit: Alfred Hitchcock, John Maxwell and Magna Entertainment
results.brief_description: This film was a major breakthrough as the first British picture with recorded sound. Based on a hit play by Charles Bennett, this taut melodrama about an ingenue who is driven to murder, then blackmailed, is one of the earliest of the master’s suspense-thrillers - a genre which he elevated to an art form. The girl, Anny Ondra, has a flirtation with a Scotland Yard inspector (Charles Paton) which leads to murder which is discovered by the blackmailer played by Donald Calthrop. The new explored sound gambits, harrowing chase sequence and offbeat montage gave 1929 audiences a nightmarish but witty film that anticipated many of Hitchcock’s classics.

results.title: The Man who knew too much
results.creator_credit: Alfred Hitchcock, Sir Michael Balcon and Gaumont
results.brief_description: A child is kidnapped by spies to ensure his silence, but he springs into action. There are memorable sequences in the film involving a dentist, an East End mission and the Albert Hall. This film was later remade by Hitchcock in America but the earlier version is more acclaimed. Peter Lorre is excellent as the sneering villain. Cast also includes Leslie Banks and Edna Best.

results.title: Jumpin' Jack Flash (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Penny Marshall, Joel Silver, Lawrence Gordon and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Whoopi Goldberg stars in this action adventure comedy hit. There’s music, murder, mayhem and a lot of laughs as she tries to save an endangered spy operative, code-named Jack - even though she’s never met him! Now the CIA and the KGB have her jumpin’ and the world may never be the same.

results.title: Rio Lobo (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Howard Hawks, Howard Hawks Productions and Malabar Productions
results.brief_description: John Wayne portrays a former Union officer searching for a traitor in this post-Civil War action drama directed by Howard Hawks. The war is over, but Col. Cord McNally (Wayne) is still hunting the informer who caused the death of a young officer. His quest brings him to the town of Rio Lobo, where he joins forces with two ex-rebels, helps save this small piece of Texas from ruthless outlaws, and finally comes face to face with his quarry. Featuring Jennifer O’Neil, Chris Mitcham and Jack Elam, this film brings together the talents of two Western legends.

results.title: South Pacific (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Joshua Logan, Buddy Adler, Magna Corporation and S P Enterprises
results.brief_description: Tender romance, an immortal score and enchanted South Seas splendour are set against the dark backdrop of a world war, in this lush and passionate musical classic. The score is as breathtaking as the South Seas setting - “Some enchanted evening”, “Bali Hai”, “There is nothing like a dame”, “Younger than springtime”, and many more. Winner of the Pulitzer Prize, “South Pacific” ranks among the most celebrated of Rodgers and Hammerstein’s acclaimed musical masterpieces. Stars Mitzi Gaynor, Rossano Brazzi, John Kerr, Ray Walston, France Nuyen and Juanita Hall as Bloody Mary.

results.title: Storm boy (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Henri Safran, Matt Carroll and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Three characters live in isolation amidst the coastal sand dunes of the Coorong in southern South Australia. In a shack on the beach live Tom, a fisherman, and his young son; out amongst the dunes lives a First Nations man, ‘Fingerbone Bill’, who forms a friendship with the boy, naming him ‘Storm Boy’. The story is conveyed with simplicity, with events being left unspoken and undetailed. The relationships between the characters, and the scenes where the boy and his pet pelican play together are subtly sketched. Burton’s photography effectively captures the wild beauty of the Coorong.
